title: go-rename.el doesn't work with symbolic link
body:
Please answer these questions before submitting your issue. Thanks!

1. What version of Go are you using (`go version`)?

    go version go1.6.2 linux/amd64 

2. What operating system and processor architecture are you using (`go env`)?
    GOARCH="amd64"
    GOBIN=""
    GOEXE=""
    GOHOSTARCH="amd64"
    GOHOSTOS="linux"
    GOOS="linux"
    GOPATH="/home/enzoc/App/go_path"
    GORACE=""
    GOROOT="/home/enzoc/.local/share/umake/go/go-lang"
    GOTOOLDIR="/home/enzoc/.local/share/umake/go/go-lang/pkg/tool/linux_amd64"
    GO15VENDOREXPERIMENT="1"
    CC="gcc"
    GOGCCFLAGS="-fPIC -m64 -pthread -fmessage-length=0"
    CXX="g++"
    CGO_ENABLED="1"

3. What did you do?
My environment:

project directory:   /home/enzoc/tmp/GoLang/emacs_setup_test   (/home/enzoc/tmp is a symbolic to /opt/enzoc/tmp)
go file directory:    /home/enzoc/tmp/GoLang/emacs_setup_test/src/cmd/helloworld/t.go

The Emacs "go-mode" would automatic set my GOPATH to /opt/enzoc/tmp/GoLang/emacs_setup_test (true directory). When I call the "go-rename", it forms the "-offset=%s" with buffer name as "/home/enzoc/tmp/GoLang/emacs_setup_test/src/cmd/helloworld/t.go" which doesn't match with the GOPATH. Then I go "Can't find package contains ..." error.

I tried from terminal to set both GOPATH and "-offset=" file name to true directory and file name, it works well. 

So I guess, if "go-rename.el" can make both the GOPATH and buffer name use the true file name or directory name, that issue should be solved. 

4. What did you expect to see?

I would like to see both GOPATH and --offset is set with true directory or file name as:
    
    GOPATH=/opt/enzoc/tmp/GoLang/emacs_setup_test/
    --offset=/opt/enzoc/tmp/GoLang/emacs_setup_test/src/cmd/helloworld/t.go:XXX

5. What did you see instead?

But what I saw is:
    GOPATH=/opt/enzoc/tmp/GoLang/emacs_setup_test/
    --offset=/home/enzoc/tmp/GoLang/emacs_setup_test/src/cmd/helloworld/t.go:XXX

That causes "gorename" return error as "Can't find package contains ...".
